question.text: In the exponential growth equation <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi>rt</mi></msup><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>,</mo></math> represents:

solution.text: The equation describes the exponential or geometric growth pattern of a population. This results in the typical <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>-shaped curve with the equation: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi>rt</mi></msup><mo>.</mo></math> In this equation, e is the base of natural logarithms <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>71828</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>.</mo></math>
